words_data.definition: A small furry animal that says meow.
A loyal pet that barks and wags its tail.
The big, bright star that gives us light and heat during the day.
The round object that shines in the sky at night.
Something you read that has pages and a cover.
A tool used for writing with ink.
A piece of clothing you wear on your head.
The color of an apple or a fire truck.
The color of the sky on a clear day.
Large in size; the opposite of small.
Little in size; the opposite of big.
To move very fast with your legs.
To push yourself off the ground into the air.
Feeling good, joyful, or smiling.
Feeling unhappy or like you want to cry.
A building where people live.
A vehicle with four wheels used for driving on roads.
A tall plant with a wooden trunk and leaves.
The colorful and pretty part of a plant.
An animal with feathers and wings that can fly.
An animal that lives and swims in the water.
The color of grass and most leaves.
The color of a lemon or the sun.
Moving at high speed.
Moving at a low speed, like a turtle.
To move on foot at a normal pace.
To do something for fun and enjoyment.
The sound you make when something is funny.
To shed tears because you are sad or hurt.
Someone you like and enjoy spending time with.
A place where children go to learn.
A person who helps students learn new things.
A person who is studying at school.
A table where you sit to do your schoolwork.
A piece of furniture used for sitting.
Thin material used for writing or drawing.
A wooden tool used for writing or drawing.
To look at words and understand what they mean.
To make letters or words on paper with a pen or pencil.
To pay attention to a sound or someone speaking.
To say words to someone.
Making very little or no noise.
A long, thin mark or a row of people.
Something used to carry things, like a backpack.
A group of students who learn together.
A female parent.
A male parent.
A boy or man who has the same parents as you.
A girl or woman who has the same parents as you.
A very young child.
A group of people who are related to each other.
The place where you live.
To put food in your mouth and swallow it.
To swallow a liquid like water or juice.
To rest with your eyes closed at night.
To care very deeply for someone.
To do something useful for someone.
Not dirty; to remove dirt from something.
To prepare food using heat.
To put your arms around someone to show love.
A round fruit that is usually red, green, or yellow.
A long yellow fruit that you peel.
A common food made from flour and baked.
A white liquid that comes from cows.
A clear liquid that we need to drink to stay alive.
A sweet baked dessert often eaten at birthdays.
Small white or brown grains eaten as food.
A food made from milk that can be hard or soft.
A sugary taste like candy.
Nice, high quality, or pleasant.
Feeling like you need to eat food.
When you have eaten enough and cannot eat more.
To enjoy something or think it is nice.
To wish for something.
To give some of what you have to others.
The top part of your body where your brain and face are.
The part of your body at the end of your arm.
The part of your body at the end of your leg.
The long part of your body used for standing and walking.
The part of your body between your shoulder and hand.
The part of your face that you use to see.
The part of your head that you use to hear.
The part of your face used for smelling and breathing.
The part of your face used for eating and speaking.
The thin strands that grow on your head.
The front part of your head.
The whole physical part of a person.
To feel pain in your body.
To clean something with water and soap.
Being in good physical condition; not sick.
Water that falls in drops from the clouds.
Soft white flakes of frozen water falling from the sky.
Moving air that you can feel outside.
A white or gray mass in the sky made of tiny water drops.
The space above the Earth where the sun and stars are.
A low temperature; the opposite of hot.
A high temperature; the opposite of cold.
A little bit hot; a pleasant temperature.
The time when it is light outside.
The time when it is dark outside and people sleep.
This present day.
The day after today.
What it is like outside (sunny, rainy, windy).
A warm piece of clothing worn over other clothes.
Strong shoes that cover your feet and lower legs.
A round object used in games and sports.
An activity with rules that people play for fun.
An object for children to play with.
A vehicle with two wheels that you pedal.
A public grassy area for playing and relaxing.
To move quickly on your feet.
To send something through the air with your hand.
To take hold of something that is moving through the air.
To hit something with your foot.
Something that is enjoyable and makes you happy.
To be the best or first in a game or contest.
To not win a game or to misplace something.
A group of people playing or working together.
An outdoor area for children to play on equipment.
To turn up the corners of your mouth because you are happy.
A piece of clothing worn on the upper body.
Clothing that covers the legs.
A piece of clothing usually worn by girls that covers the body and legs.
Something you wear on your feet to protect them.
Soft clothing worn on the feet inside shoes.
A short, light coat.
Something you wear on your head.
To have clothing on your body.
Something that has just been made or bought.
Something that has existed for a long time.
Free from dirt or stains.
Covered with dirt or stains.
To get something by paying money for it.
To think something is nice or pretty.
Red, blue, green, and yellow are examples of this.
A word used to agree or say 'it is so'.
A word used to disagree or refuse.
A polite word used when asking for something.
Polite words used to show you are grateful.
A word used to apologize for a mistake.
A common greeting when you see someone.
What you say when you are leaving.
To give support or assistance.
To finish moving or doing something.
To move from one place to another.
To move toward the person speaking.
To use your eyes to see something.
To notice or look at something with your eyes.
To hear and pay attention to sounds.
To stay in one place until something happens.
